result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:27 am. Prosecuting Attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant SANDRA L THUNDERCLOUD in court.  Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for SANDRA L THUNDERCLOUD. Atty. Kolell enters not guilty plea to Count 1.

8:27 am. Prosecuting Attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant SANDRA L THUNDERCLOUD in court.  Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for SANDRA L THUNDERCLOUD. Defense waives the preliminary hearing.  Court advises party of their right to a preliminary hearing, accepts waiver and binds over for Arraignment. ADA Nelson informs the Court that the INFO will be filed within 10 days and will mirror the C/C. Based on that representation, Atty. Kolell waives the reading of the INFO and wishes to proceed directly into the ARGN today.
Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
